<!-- Thanks for taking the time to report this build failure. To proceed with the report please:

1. Title the issue "Installation issue: <name-of-the-package>".
2. Provide the information required below.

We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively! -->

### Steps to reproduce the issue

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->
```console
$ spack install py-torch@1.4.0

==> Installing py-torch-1.4.0-c7frpmbymqqbsuripw5sh5npugsadueh
==> No binary for py-torch-1.4.0-c7frpmbymqqbsuripw5sh5npugsadueh found: installing from source
==> Using cached archive: /usr/WS1/aml_user/tools/spack/var/spack/cache/_source-cache/git//pytorch/pytorch.git/v1.4.0.tar.gz
==> Warning: Fetching from mirror without a checksum!
This package is normally checked out from a version control system, but it has been archived on a spack mirror. This means we cannot know a checksum for the tarball in advance. Be sure that your connection to this mirror is secure!
==> Using cached archive: /usr/WS1/aml_user/tools/spack/var/spack/cache/_source-cache/archive/17/17561b16cd2db22f10c0fe1fdcb428aecb0ac3964ba022a41343a6bb8cba7049
==> py-torch: Executing phase: 'install'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
'/usr/WS1/aml_user/tools/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-haswell/gcc-7.3.0/python-2.7.18-7zkgtan7i7efedgkyqxa3talv7zma5io/bin/python2.7' '-s' 'setup.py' '--no-user-cfg' 'install' '--prefix=/usr/WS1/aml_user/tools/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-haswell/gcc-7.3.0/py-torch-1.4.0-c7frpmbymqqbsuripw5sh5npugsadueh' '--single-version-externally-managed' '--root=/'

$ cat spack-build-out.txt
....
==> py-torch: Executing phase: 'install'
==> [2021-01-12-12:24:38.627661] '/usr/WS1/aml_user/tools/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-haswell/gcc-7.3.0/python-2.7.18-7zkgtan7i7efedgkyqxa3talv7zma5io/bin/python2.7' '-s' 'setup.py' '--no-user-cfg' 'install' '--prefix=/usr/WS1/aml_user/tools/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-haswell/gcc-7.3.0/py-torch-1.4.0-c7frpmbymqqbsuripw5sh5npugsadueh' '--single-version-externally-managed' '--root=/'
fatal: Not a git repository (or any parent up to mount point /tmp)
Stopping at filesystem boundary (GIT_DISCOVERY_ACROSS_FILESYSTEM not set).
Building wheel torch-1.4.0
-- Building version 1.4.0
Could not find /tmp/cdoutrix/spack-stage/spack-stage-py-torch-1.4.0-c7frpmbymqqbsuripw5sh5npugsadueh/spack-src/third_party/fbgemm/CMakeLists.txt
Did you run 'git submodule update --init --recursive'?
....

```

Seems to be a bug in 1.4.0, recommended to remove this version.

### Information on your system
* **Spack:** 0.16.0
* **Python:** 3.7.2
* **Platform:** linux-rhel7-haswell

### Additional information

<!-- Please upload the following files. They should be present in the stage directory of the failing build. Also upload any config.log or similar file if one exists. -->
* [spack-build-out.txt]()
* [spack-build-env.txt]()

<!-- Some packages have maintainers who have volunteered to debug build failures. Run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mention them here if they exist. -->
@adamjstewart 

Related to #20801

### General information

title: Installation issue: pytorch@1.4.0
